SURPRISE PARTY! "why do you have a camera?..oh my g-d!!!!" yeah, so tonight i had the biggest surprise of my life i think...my mom and staci threw me a surprise 16th birthday party, about a month late. they said they have been planning it all summer.
so i went to the mall with marc and sarah(my big bro and his g/f) and i got the the blue swede shoes i had wanted before but didn't have my size in. they are so cool! we shopped and walked around for a while. we went home and i was planning on taking a nap so that i would be energized when i went to go babysit tonight. i walk through the kitchen door and see my dad stading in the corner with his digatle camera (it's his newish toy, so he plays with it often.) so i say "why do you have a camera?" walk in a little bit more to put my bag down on the table, and BAM! the word "SURPRISE!!!!" came out of my friends mouths who were stanind in the family room. i yelled "oh my g-d!" in shock. i couldn't believe it. i really had no clue.
i was so happy for more then one reason, first off that they did this for me, second b/c my mom kept a secret.....this is a surprise in it self, she is horable at keeping secrets. i really have never had such a big secret kept from me all the way.

"i want to make love on you" i just spent the night with Miss Ashley!!!! ok, so lets start at the begining [meaning friday].....friday was a happy day just b/c it was friday. i had espanol and i actually didn't want to shrivle up and die that class period! {hey, miracles can happen} ian and i went home with staci and chillied at her casa for a while. we watched office space, a very funny movie. later we watched save the last dance, such a chick flick, ian wanted to shoot himself in the foot, but soon enough we got distracted and went and played in staci's mom's gym. (gym..whats a gym?{walks in} ohhh a gym!) we tried to teach ian how to dance [any kind of dancing] but we was just way too white in his farmer jack plad shirt. staci ordered pizza, and while she did so ian and i chased her around the house making sex sounds. it t'was a fun evening. saturday i went over to steven n.'s house to work on the wheels video, which is going to be so cool. hillary joined us a little later. i got to see other peoples pictures and all i could do was smile. it was so cool how all these moments are like ingraved into my head and i can see them perfectly, i can even remember a lot of the roads we drove along in the middle of nowheres vill. i miss wheels, i think it just went by way too fast. after going through countless pictures i went to the mall with ian to get a gift for another friend. it was quite the trip; ian didn't want to actually purchase the gift, so he gave me money to do so. i bought it, but as soon as the guy gave me change i made sure to hand it back to ian and say in a loud voice "heres your change!" it was quite amussing, maybe you had to be there....maybe you had to know what this said gift is...shhh! i can't tell! ian came home with me and soon enough ashley came over!!! we all layed in my room and looked at all my stars that are ohh so pretty. after ian went home ashley and i debated whether or not to bake cookies. we started to watch forset gump(one of my favorite movies) and at around 12 we desided that now would be a good time to bake cookies. we kinda ate half the batter..::mhh, batter...raw eggs...mmhhh:: the cookied came out kinda,well, bad, but that is just cause we didn't put the rack up high enough so the bottum of all the cookies burned a little. they are lightly 'browned'. i love the nights i spend with ashley, we may go to bed at 1 but we lay in bed talking until around 3. we talk about anything and everything, it is just to relaxing and comforting. my daddy was supose to take me driving this weekend but i dunno if we are going to find time. =( i really need to start driving more often, i have had my permitt since february. i can get my lisence next month except for the fact that i have no where near enough driving hours, i haven't taken drivers ed. [can't take it until second quarter, which is a blower] and i have to take behind the wheel, which i can't take until i am in drivers ed. so i actually won't be getting it until sometime during winter. =P it is weird, my parents wondered why i don't ask to go out and drive more often and the only reason i could think of was that i just forget that i can. if that makes sence...i just forget that i am allowed to drive, that i am able to do so. it is also kinda scarey getting behind the wheel, i get nervous that i am going to mess up, i also get frustrated that i'm not just able to do everything, b/c when watching someone else it really does just look easy, and until you do it enough, it really isn't all that easy.

‘say who is that man walking down the street, he's so fine he's got the beat!' ahh, that one is going on Jew Jams , Peter gets %20 for thinking of the name. I am in a very jewish-song-sing-a-long mood right now, dunno why. Picture day! Not really a happy thing, but we got to get out of class to get them taken. I hate these pictures. The people who take them just seem like they hate their job and wish they were somewhere else. Meaning that they really don't care what your picture ends up looking like, might i add, the picture that goes in the yearbook. So you sit there, they place your head in some unnatural position, tell you to smile, take a few moments to adjust the camera and 1..pause....2.3! your picture is taken and you start to wonder how bad it really is. Fake smiles never look the same...Today actually went by kinda fast, i fell asleep in chemistry..i dunno if that was a bad thing or not. The teacher is so boring, she is one of those teachers who likes to talk and talk about nothing for long periods of time, then she slips in something that actually matters, but you are so zoned out by that point that you miss it. or at least thats what happens to me. In art i feel that i am finally opening up to new ideas and have stopped dwelling on the fact that i stink at realistic drawing. I am having quite a bit of fun with the materials, especially charcoal, which is also just fun to put on Ian. In math i feel like i am falling a little behind, not so good. It really isn't hard stuff we are doing, it is just that i don't remember, i need a few refreshers on algebra. Right after i got home my mommy took me to the mall!! And i got a new pair of pretty red sneekers, they are quite comfy. I'm not quite sure when it happened, but somewhere between the ages of 14 and 16 i began to think of shoes are collectibles. They are fun to buy, i like having them, and there is no real reason for having all of them, the true characteristics of a collection. I almost got two pairs, but they didn't have my size, which was a real bummer, i almost got blue swede shoes! Oh they were pretty, maybe next time. Tonight after a nice two hour nap i started on my homework. I started with spanish, did some other stuff then somehow i ended up with just as much spanish as i started with. I know i complain about it all the time, but i really do hate it. i want to take the class pass/fail, but i dunno if my parental units will let me. [pass/fail meaning you take the class and as long as you get above a D+ all quarters you pass the class, and the class is omitted from your GPA. So i would get credit for doing it, just no real grade.] i think it would take off a lot of the stress. I really don't know if i can pull threw this class.

'what are we?' can be the worst question for someone to hear when they are in a relationship, for me it was... i still don't know the anwser...does it even matter? why do people need titles? does that make the relationship better or last longer if you know that you are boyfriend and girlfriend? can a long distance relationship ever work out when you are in high school? every single question is racing through my mind in order to find the ultimate answer to the worst question.. 'what are we?' am i being stupid taking so much thought on to a simple question? should i wake up and see the truth around me,..that just b/c you want something so bad doesn't mean you are going to get it. i have said it to other people, it has been said to me :"no guy is worth crying over, and the one that is, won't make you cry." i am starting to wonder if there really is such a guy...it is quite hard to believe, after all what do teenagers know about love? harsh statement, but true...is it possible for teens to feel love, i am talking about true love, at such a young age? what if it is, but just b/c of age things don't work out....will you find another love just the same?

today while i was spacing out in math i was looking around the room and i saw some of the posters around the room which i had never really paid any attention to, it said something to the effect of 'tips for solving maths problems'. i started off on one of my random wanderings of thought and wondered why there can't be a simple little poster that has 'tips for solving lifes problems'. i dunno where i am going with this, i guess it is just un unresolved thought. aahh! unresolved! i hate that word! i hate it when my art teacher has to use that word whenever she talks about my art work. anyway, i was snapped out of my little trans by this boy {who i have a hard time not smaking up side the head} who was humming. it slowly became the only thing i could hear. why is it that when you hear something you rather not hear it become the point of your focus?it is as if it becomes the only thing you can hear no matter how hard you try to ignore it. if you have no idea what i am rambling on about, here is an example: just image yourself lying in bed, trying to fall asleep, all of a sudden you hear a faint ringing noise, for the next hour or so you lay awake listening and focusing on the sound, you can't ignore it or block it our b/c you are trying to. whatever, maybe it's just me.

SUCH AN AMAZING WEEK AT INTERNATIONAL CONVENTION IN 2OrlandO2! YAY JEWS! wow i have lots to say, so sit back and enjoy!
so, i went to the air port bright and early at around 5 am. i met all my seaboard friends there and even made a new friend; Irina! after standing in line for quite sometime we got on the plane and we were off to sunny FL. i sat next to Irina and we became instant friends, very cool. when we got to the hotel we had some free time were i got to see all my wheels friends and some other kids from other regions. and then we had opening cerimonies, which is like my favoritest part of the whole convention, b/c everyone is so excited and energized to be there and full of ruach! i love ruach! {oh we are the seaboard region and we've got ruuuaaacchhh!!!!!} after all that excitement we had dinner and i sat with some kids from texas, yee-haw! after dinner we had our busA reunion, which was so cool. it was so weird yet so right to all be in the same rom again. although it wasn't everyone it felt just like old times. it was amazing how it really felt like i had just seen them the other day, not 5 months ago. the reunion went by way too fast and i wanted to stay there all night with them. we found out some of the staff's little secrets and just other little things that looking back on are just funny. after the reunion i went to the regional t-shirt sale. i got a sweat shirt that says 'canada EH!' and two other t-shirts. soon it was time for us to go up to outr rooms, and at that point i still didn't know who my room mates were. turns out to preppy freshman and a quiet sophmore. luckfully my room joined to hillary and danilles, who are some how always roomed together. monday was an interesting day. started out with me waking up hillary by running anf jumping on her and sining "rise and shine" to her. during the day we had a lot of free time. we went to downtown dinesy which is like a total tourest trap. it is just all shops and stores filled with over priced dinsey pooh. i had a great chat with hillary, benji and alex outside next to the ppol. the weather was sooo nice! later in the day sarah and asher came to visit, which was so much fun. he went down to visit her for the week and then they came to visit us. i miss sarah so much, i forgot how amazing of a person she is. after spending a while catching up with them we had dinner then a nice preforance from a group of isreali teenage dancers and singer. we got front row seats and it was a great show, even if they were lip singing. tuesday we went to disney world were we met sarah and asher again. we had so much fun catching up. it was raining on and off during the day. it was amusing seeing people run for shelter when it started pooring, even the people who paid for those stupid mickey mouse ponchoes for like 6 bucks. while we all stood out side and let the rain soak us. i even took hillarys hand and started to dance with her. the rain even inproved one of the rides. it made it like ten times cooler. it was hard saying bye to asher and sarah, the day just went by so fast. when we got back to the hotel we just had study groups and what not. christmas is so much fun! {not very often you hear a jew say that} but being there with 1500 other jews makes you realize that not everyone is celebrating xmas. you really forget that it is even a special day. there were elections in the afternoon for international board, which i can't even vote for. so i just stayed for the presedential elecetion which everyone has to stay for then left after i found out our new president is from canada! i spent most of my free time hanging out with ronya which was fun. she got pushed in the pool! haha! that night was the dance, which was followed by the indoction of the new board, which seemed to take FOREVER! the dance was cool, except for the fact that the dance floor was sooo small. i was having a great time until i got some not so great news and all of a suden i didn't feel like dancing much anymore. so i ended up talking with zach s. for the next two hours. it was such a great conversation. it ranged from boys to love, music to sex, art to family. it was just what i needed. thursday we had closing cerimonies and then it was time to say goodbye. it didn't seem as hard this time as it did at the end of wheels, not sure why, but it was a lot easier. after all the goodbyes and a few tears we got on a bus and went to MGM for the day. it was cool going there, but nothing that great. the tower of terror is always fun. danielle and i went off on our own and got fake tatoos and then proceded to get very confused. we thought the meeting point was somewhere where is wasn't. we ended up having to call the staff and run out to the buses. it all turned out fine and nobody besideds the staff knew that we were the ones that held up the buses. the next 3 hours were spent on a bus going to ft. lauderdale, where out post convention was. when we got there we got out stuff and were split up and went to out host family homes then straight to bed. i was grouped with 3 other girls, while hillary and danielle were together at some other house, as always. it is weird how all the houses there are only one level, but whatever. the house we stayed in was fine, besideds away too annoying jewish mother. "you hungry?!" "you sure you don't want anything to eat?!" "you hungry?!" aarrgghh, she got on my nervse. anyway, friday we went to the beach which was so nice. i love going to the beach. even though it was a little chilli (still nicer then here) and a little breezie it was still great. paul drew a picture of me and i flew a kite. =) i love beaches, just the whole vibe they have; the crashing water, the sand on your feet, the hot sun warming you and the sky, which looks like it never ends. soon we had to leave the beach and go get ready for shabbos. we had shabat services and 2 whole hours of ruach! saturday we had services then had some free time, i sat with irina and danielle and got a little sun before we had to get back into our nice clothing and say goodbye to shabat. after sundown we went an got changed for the dance which a few other regions attended aswell. it was at an I-MAX which was cool. there were a whole bunch of animals and such there too, and i ran away from the snakes like a little school girl, quite funny, but i still get the chills just thinking about them, growdy! the dance was a lot of fun though, a lot of sluty booty dancing. but i got to see a few of my wheels friends again, which was fun. sunday we said goodbye to all the ft. lauderdale kids and went to this mall that was over a mile long and a whole bunch of outlet stores. i just got a ron jons surf shop t-shirt. we went into a tv store and got suckered in to watching a demo for some sound system which was a total waste of time. i have no idea why they asked us (6 teenage kids) to go see it, it's not like any of us could afford it. anyway after two hours in the huge mall we wen to the airport. i got searched at the security! mehh, it was b/c of my belt but they had to use the little metal detector thingie. we spent like 3 hours at the air port which was quite boring but we just layed around talking. first we flew to atlanta on this huge plane then from atalanta to dulles. i got off the plane and i realized how much i really didn't want to go home. yeah i wanted to see my family and friends, but i had such a great time away i just wanted it to keep going. i was talking with danielle and we desided that USY trips aren't real life. everything about them feels so fake, in a good way. the time just kinda blurs together and you never sleep but you are always having fun so it doesn't matter. you are with some of the greatest people and there is just nothing else like it. you don't have to worry about anything really. i love it, and only wish everyone could know the feeling.
monday i slept until 1ish which was nice considering i had been running on an average of about 5 hours of sleep a night. i went over to staci's and told her all my little stories. we watched legally blond and caught up. then out to TC to bum around. i got a new pair of jeans that i am in love with! and after i went back to her house and slept over. when i came home this morning i went out to price club and got stuff with my daddy and dropped off two of my three rolls of film from the past week. then home to watch something about marry. now i am waiting until 8 when staci and ian come over for new years. they are both sleeping over and i have nothing planned, so this should be interesting. ::shrug:: we always find ways to keep ourselves busy.
i desided not to have a new years resolution and just to go with the flow. there is nothing i really want to change in my life at the moment and when there is, i will change it. i am pretty happy right now, i dunno if it is b/c i am not in school or what, but i will try my best to stay this happy for a while. thank goodness for ashley. i don't know what i would do without her, really, with out her number on my wall i would be sulking on my bed, stairing at the ceiling wondering why my life sucks so much. you know how some people have there 'quiet place' to go and reflect on their thoughts and to just be alone, well i have ashley. when i want to talk to someone about feelings and just hear happy things, i call her. i only wish that she was an 8 and a half minute car ride away as apposed to a long distanance phone call away. she reminds me that it is alright to feel upset or mad, but at the same time tells me that there is hardly a point. why dwell on something, it only makes it worse. and it is so true, although i do still feel mildly upset. i think it is the book i am reading; the perks of being a wall flower. it is really having an effact on me. i am not sure why, i but i really feel as if i know this 'charlie' and that he is my friend. or maybe it is just a sad story that you don't want to be true for anyone. it is a wonderful book, but who knew it could make me feel oh so many different emotions?.... last night at 1am when i couldn't sleep, i wrote jonathan a letter, after all he was the reason i couldn't fall asleep. it took me a while to write it, and it was pretty short too, but i kept on pausing inbetween sentanctes, trying to clear my thoughs, it never worked and my mind would stumble on to something else. after i finished the letter i put in in an envelope and sealed it, with out reading over it i put his address on it and a stamp and first thing this morning i put it in the mailbox not even thinking about it. but now i am...i can't quite recall everything i said, after all it was 1 in the morning. i wish i hadn't sent it already though, i am sure it isn't that bad, but it is pretty emotional and i just don't like to play the part of an overly emotional teenage girl who can't handle herself. it really bothers me when i see other people like that, and it makes me even more upset when i start to see myself acting like that. but sometimes i really can't help it. i am starting to think it really is just part of being a teenager. i have noticed that sometimes i think irrationaly, when really i shouldn't, i mean the world isn't going to come to an end b/c i failed a test, but sometimes at the 'point of impact' it really feels as if it is going to. i like to think of myself as a happy person. i don't have any desire to be 'dark' or 'mysterious' like i see many of my other friends trying to accomplish. but i think in the end you really just need to be yourself, and every once in a while you are allowed that 'off day' or even week, where everything can suck, even if it really doesn't. you need those times to show you how wonderful your happy times are. it might be cliqué but it is so true.

alright, so snow came and got me all off track with everything, which is fine. so now i am getting my license tomorrow, which i am so excited about, i am just trying to figure out where will i go first? today during behind the wheel while we were driving around beside having everyone look at us b/c of the huge cheese-wedge-sign on top of the car; we saw an accident, complete with paramedics and all. my instructure started talking about it, all i could think about was the fact that it could happen any time, and it doesn't even have to be b/c of me. it is fricken scary. it's also another step in growing up, which is just about as scary. i am getting letters from different collages, telling me why i should apply to their school. i don't even want to think about it. it just leads to me thinking about what i am going to do after college...and AHHH! just makes me want to scream, curl up into a ball and stay in my moms arms forever. at the same time i want to experiance all that life has to offer me, i want to go out into the world and live my life as best as i can, but it is just so scary and coming so fast. it's so true what they say, 'when your young, you want to be older. when your old you want to be younger.' well i when i was little i couldn't wait for the day i would have my license, it really is a big turning point in ones life, at least mine. when i was little time used to go by so slowly. all i wanted was to be a cool 16 year old who could drive around, go to parties and have a million friends. now i am 16 and i feel like the same little kid, just with longer legs. when i was younger i guess i thought some amazing transformation would take place when you get to be in your teens, but really you are the same person, just with a few more complex thoughts. and i can't for the life of me figure out how i got from there to here in what seems like so little time. well, thats enough rambling about not wanting to grow up. i guess i better get used to the idea.

teenage life it pretty much sucks as a whole. everyday you come home feeling like your life is insignificant, there is not point to your existance, your fat and ugly, your stupid, no one is ever going to love you for you, no one really knows the REAL you, and that no one else in the entire world understands and knows how you are feeling. oh, and don't forget the age old question of 'why/how are we here?' well, i wish i could be one of the first teenager to say i haven't thought any of those things, but the fact is i have thought all of them, i still do sometimes. so right now my mind set is: just try and be as happy as you can, if this time is going to suck you might aswell try and get a few good days out of it. i was talking to my big bro adam who i really inspire to be like. he really loves life. and i was asking him if it was just me and the people i know that are feeling this way, and mainly he told me that it's not just me and my friends, it's more like my whole school and every other high school for that matter. but you really just have to remember that when life gives you lemons you have to make orange juice. =) [think about it for a while]. i know sooooo many/too many people who are depressed and just think life isn't going to get any better and that it has nothing to offer them. number one i want to give all of them a giant hug then try and show them that life is such a gift, and they shouldn't throw it away with drugs, alcohol, depression and doubt that there is no one who loves you. i really do believe that every single person is truely loved by at least one other, whether they know it or not. i know everyone has their bad days (sometimes bad weeks or months even) but there has to be a reason for you to be here, so what if you never find out what that reason is. advice for all you unhappy with your crappy teenager life: go kick yourself in the head for being such a dumbass! life is the best, i mean, without life you wouldn't even know you are unhappy. and if you think you are unhappy why don't you go and try and change it and become happy, and if you can't change it then find a way around it, cause no matter what no one or thing has the right to take away your happiness.

SPRING CONVENTION 2003 RAIN, RAIN, RAIN, RAIN, RAIN. Thats all it did the whole weekend, but i still had a blast. On Thursday after ethan took me to see the matrix {which was amazing} i came home, packed and went off to get on the bus to be taken to a sleep away camp in west VA. On the way up we watched Fight Club and i did danielle's hair. Before i knew it we were there and getting our stuff off the bus. We got our name tags and it made my day that mine had a yellow ribbon on it reading "ASK ME". It was so that people who were interested in going on wheels could ask me questions, too bad no one did, but hey, i had a ribbon! while getting my new seaboard scrubs, which are like 10 sizes too big, two other people could fit in them with me...we shall have to try that later, i was greeted by mike, who was then forced into helping danielle and i carry our stuff back to our bunk. I was in the same bunk as danielle...and thats it. none of my other friends were in the same bunk as us. And yes half the reason of USY is to meet new people, but i hardly get to see the people i already know, and that really is one of the main reason i go to so much USY stuff. Anyway, after dropping my stuff off i got to see a bunch of people i haven't seen in the longest time. That night we did ice breakers, which i think most of the time are ather pointless, but this time it was fun, especially since danny wise decided to single me out in this ‘moo game' it's not a hard game, the point is to get an unsuspecting person to yell ‘moo' very loudly, i was that lucky person who ended up in the fetal position in the corner after turning bright red and realizing i was yelling ‘moo' to the whole room. After games i don't really remember what we did but i know i was unhappy about going back to my bunk, where i could not fall asleep. I tried my best throughout the weekend to spread my SARS on to others...by the end of the week many had SARS like symptoms such as myself...mwahaha! Friday was election day. a very stressful time for some and a rather boring time for others. I was caught in the middle, seeing as who a few of my closest friends were running for regional board which is a tremendous job. First up matt welik won president which is pretty awesome considering he is only a senior and was running against a junior. Shiri won SA/TO easily against the drop down candidate. Then jacob wolf with a very cute ‘do you believe in magic?' speech won, he looked so adorable in his tux, top hat and white gloves. Steven won communications and i am so proud of him, he really deserves to be it. and even with a kickass nomination song written by danielle and myself which was in perfect time i might add, unfortunately hillary did not win, but i am still proud f her for having the guts to run in the first place, i am sure she is upset, but she will over come it and she still has another year where she can run! Before shabbos came we had some free time. I just hung out with some friends and tried not to get too wet out in the rain. We had some boring study groups and some speeches. Saturday got up about ten minutes before we had to be at services, i just put a skirt on over my pjs and went off for the ‘mind' services which was suppose to get us to meditate, it was relaxing to sit there with my eyes closed. During free time i talked with jacob who let me have his extra camera b/c i forgot to remember to bring mine, such a sweety, and told steven that if he doesn't get his first kiss before he turns 18 then i would kiss him. Oohh poor steven, as long as he doesn't get so desperate and try to do stuff with morgan. I also spent time with zach. He is such an awesome guy to hang out with. Our relationship is completely plutonic, even though just about anyone else would think otherwise. He is just a touchy-feely person, but he makes my day so wonderful and i never stop laughing when i am with him. I met his friend noah at services that night, he is a pretty interesting guy, he and i both like eye liner and eye shadow, and he has the same shade nail polish as me! There was a speeker who told like 5 stories, none of which i listened to....ehh. after dinner was the dance. I danced a little, but got bored and just didn't feel like dancing so i ended up going in to watch zoolander, which is such a funny movie. After the movie i went back to the dance and got my promised dance from marc. And we watched a slide show of pictures from throughout the year. When we were told to all go back to our bunks, i went with hillary and allison to the boys bunk until got kicked out. We spent the next few hours peeking out the window, waiting for the conclers to go away so we could go back into the boys bunk. I ended up sleeping with hillary and was the best sleep i had the whole time i was there, so warm and comfy! Sunday i got out of hillarys and wearing the same thing i had on since the night before went to services and then breakfast, where we sat for a few hours listening to ravid, installing the new board and just other people talking. Then we had to say our goodbyes and get on the bus to go home. I got two seats to myself, put my head phones on, curled up in a ball and slept the whole time. When i got home and was talking to staci, who had called me for all the juicy detail of my weekend i realized how much i really love USY! I forget when i go so long without seeing some of these people. people who are so nice and caring, and willing to talk. People who would do anything for you in a heart beat, and put a smile on your face. People with so much ruach and spirt that it makes you want to get up and dance. People who you feel like you have known forever even if you haven't see them for ages. People who are so comfortable that they can come up and double hump you![don't ask] I really just love being with these people, it is as simple as that. Time always flies when with them and i wouldn't trade these events for anything. I feel sorry that not all my other nonjewish friends can't take part in these event and even if they are in a youth group, i truely don't think there is anything like USY. Maybe a biased opinion, but oh well. Anyway, i had a blast and can't wait until encampment in August, until then thankfully i have my license and a car and i hope to see these people a lot more often over this summer. if i forgot anything, sorry to all of you who where there and feel forgotten, i am extremly tired and can hardly remember how to type.
P.S.- i got a job! at CVS. this past week i had my first two days, both went alright and i actually don't mind going there to work. tadah! growing up! so scarey!

the other night we had some family friends over and my mom was showing off my pottery; as the motherly thing to do. and i got a great many complements which were a nice boost in slef-esteme, then i got the question of "is this what you want to do for a living?" my usual answer of "no, it;s just for fun, not money, it is more of a stress releafe then anything else." now at this point all other people have said something to the efect of 'oh, thats good, glad you have a hobby.' and they have left it at that. this woman who seems to be of the pushy yet nice type continued in a series of questions of " why don;t you do it as your career? your good at it and you enjoy it? you could make a lot of money doing this. why do you want to go to art school, if thats not even what you are going to do? you should just have it be our career since you are good at it and enjoy it so much, it makes you happy..." and so on. and i pretty much just wrote it off as complements until now, and i have started to wonder why it is i have told myself that i don't want to be an artist as a career. sure there have been many times where i have doubted myself in the feild, but pottery is my strong point as well as my favorite, why not do it for my career? sure there are a million reasons not too, but there are a million and one to. i always talk about doing what makes you happy, and the fact that you only have one life and you should do whatever it is that fills your soul with delight. well, why don;t i go on that basis? oh right, b/c i don;t want to die poor and alone in a small shack while sitting at my pottery wheel trying to finish some big order for some rich bastards.

STOMP was the greatest ever. it was better then i expected. it was creative, and expressive and made me want to have a talent full of bursting energy. it also made ian, staci, kirby, natalie and i want to be in the show. the best part of the night, besideds the show it self was coming out of the metro station, when we all went hoping and bopping down the hall making our own version of a beat. that is a moment i want to store in a bottle on my dresser and whenever i feel a little glum, open it and remember how wonderful i felt in that moment with my friends, acting like a fool and not caring at all, b/c i was with them. got in a little trouble with my ma and pa cause i didn't call home, and well made them worry, which made me feel gulty, but hey, whatcha going to do. my punichment is having to write my summer program essay by the end of the week. hehe. gotta love them for trying. saturday morning i left with staci and her family for Homestead. a 5 star ritzy-ditzy hotel and skiing resort to go skiing. (for the first time ever!) when we got there after the 3 hour ride we had lunch and then went snow tubing. which was like sledding with out the work. they pull you up the hill, then you slide back down, so fun. that night we had plans for dancing the night away, until we foundout that it was only for those 21 and over. pooh on only being 17! we watched american pie 3 and got all rested up for the day ahead. we had a yummy breakfast with anything you could ever ask for and then went and got skis and had a little beginners lession. surprisingly i caught on after a little while and out of any sport i have every tried to learn, this one i have to say has been the best match. after a few trial runs on the learners course i went onto the bunny slope and had a the wonderful rush of the wind in my face and the thrill of speading down a mountin. our lessions were over and staci desided to go back to the gynormouse hotel, and i kept skiing. but i wasn't alone for long. as i was getting on the lift i heard someone behind me ask to get on with me so he did and we started talking. and his name (or his middle name, which he goes by) is Banning, and he has been skiing and snowboarding for over 7 years, so he was uber good. he wanted me to go to the top with him, and i said no b/c it was about my third time going down at all, but maybe next time. so i went down, then he got on the lift with me again and i said what the heck and went to the top with him and tried my hardest to go down the blue slope...tried being the key word, after getting about half way down by falling, i took off my skis and he took them down to the bunny slopes as i took the walk of shame. it all good i laughed each time i fell, needless to say i spent a lot of time laughing. i spent the rest of the afternoon just going down the bunny slope laughing my head off having a great time. it was really a lot of fun. banning helped me out a lot and was good company. after he left i went back to the hotel and had afternoon tea! but no crumpets...but little sandwiches with out the crusts. then staci and i played two games of bowling in this palce called a 'hotel' but i tend to think of it as a whole city. then we had sherly temples and popcorn at a bar and played pool and darts. staci owes me her first born child. we went back to the room b/c i was pooped. got a surprise call from banning and had a few more laughs. took a minor nap then had a loverly room service dinner, then watched some TV and fell asleep. we got up the next morning and drove home. i am a little sore, but it was worth it. surprisingly my arms hurt more then my legs, i am guessing from when i was on flat ground and tried to use my polls to pull me along. meeh. i had a great time and i can't wait to go skiing again!

Dear Marilyn, Bob, Marc, Ethan and Ariel,
I realize our sudden decision to move to California has thrown you all for a loop. I feel the need to explain myself to all of you because you have all called and asked Adam if this is the right thing to do, the right time to do it and whether we were really doing the right thing for us. Adam and I have made this decision together as a couple. We decided a long time ago that the Bay Area is where we wanted to end up and eventually raise a family. I have always known that I needed to be back in the Bay Area and be near my family.
The next thing that I want to bring up is the issue of my family and my relationship with them. I know you all do not understand my relationship with my parents , and I don't think you ever will because none of you are only children. I can only say that only children have quite different relationships with their parents than families with more children. I am not saying that one is better than the other, they are just different. I think my relationship with my parents is even more special because of how they managed to keep us together like a family while also getting a divorce. They did a very special thing by separating their differences from how they were going to raise me and what was best for me.
I know you all think that I talk to my mom too much and that maybe our relationship is too dependent. But you just don't understand our relationship. I don't pretend to understand the relationships you all have with each other, so I don't think you can try to guess what our relationship is like. My mom raised me by herself. We had a lot of alone time together. That was and is very special for me. We still need alone time together, just like I need alone time with my Dad. Both of my parents had many times while I was growing up where they had me to themselves thus that is what we all crave sometimes. It is just who we are and I am sorry that it is so hard for you to understand . I hope that you will all provide us with your blessings on our new adventure in SF. We are truly looking forward to it and hope that you will all visit. I love you all and want you to realize that I am not taking away your son or your brother, and I hope that one day I can understand the dynamics of a large family, and at the same time you can see the beauty of my family.
With all my love, Kate

tonight i set out to get some art supplies, but as i was pulling out of the driveway i noticed the sunset, and that became my new destination. i drove over to town center and went into the parking garage i hate so much (only b/c the other one was blocked off) parked on the second level and ran um the other 4 flights of stairs. i got to the top and watched as the big orange orb slowly sank into the horizon. it was perfect. at first i wished i had someone there with me, a friend, a boy, someone to hold me and comment on just how beautiful the neon glow was, but i was standing there all by my lonesome, but then it was refreshingly nice to know that i can do this on my own. i felt sort of impowered, knowing that i don't NEED anyone to do this with, although it still would have been nice. then just as i was leaving a young guy (about my age, maybe a few years older) with carrot top red hair pulled up behind me. and got out with barefeet, i commented to him that "he missed a good one" as i was walking away, he said something i didn't catch then "have a good night" in a very sencre and gentelmenly way. after i was wa few more paces to the steps i realized that i should have gone back and talked to him, but i was too far and it would have been weird. but none the less it made me smile. and i am actually glad i didn't go back, b/c that moment was perfect in itself, and i wouldn't have wanted it to be anyother way.
